channel.title: Compartmentalization on RD's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Compartmentalization on RD's Blog

item.title: AKAP Signaling Complexes: Focal Points in Space and Time
item.description: Comprehensive notes on AKAPs as molecular scaffolds that regulate spatial and temporal signaling by anchoring PKA and other enzymes, enabling precise phosphorylation events in response to cellular stimuli.

item.title: AKAP Signaling Complexes: Focal Points in Space and Time
item.description: Comprehensive notes on AKAPs as molecular scaffolds that regulate spatial and temporal signaling by anchoring PKA and other enzymes, enabling precise phosphorylation events in response to cellular stimuli.

item.title: αKAP as an Anchoring Protein for a Novel CaMKII Isoform in Skeletal Muscle
item.description: Notes on a landmark 1998 EMBO paper identifying αKAP as the first anchoring protein for CaM kinase II, revealing how αKAP targets CaMKII to the sarcoplasmic reticulum in skeletal muscle and enables tissue-specific membrane localization and signaling control.
